comment: Mrs. Watson is the BEST professor I have ever taken at KSU. She is super sweet and really takes time to go through chapter materials during class. She also gives us little tips on how to easily remember some formulas/concepts. Her tests aren't hard and she does a little quiz at the end of each class which she is offering help with as well.

She is a really good professor love her. Really easy class. GO to class because she gives assignments at the end of each class. Homework is on ALEKS and the test has questions from ALEKS. Do study if you are not good at precalc and ask questions.

Professor Watson is by all means a great teacher, she knows how to explain fundamental concepts very well, and is always willing to stop and answer questions. That being said she does seem to stuff a lot into the exams causing it to be a little bit harder to feel as if you truly have the entire thing down.

Do the homework and show up to class!!! Even if you're 2-5 minutes late you miss a chunk of the lecture. Shes super kind and willing to help, I just hated how packed the tests were with like 4-5 units. Look at study guide and ask questions! You're only graded on tests, homework and attendance. Go to class it is worth it!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Watson is one of my favorite professors thus far. In class, she explains things thoroughly and breaks them down well so that everyone understands. I am not that good in math but after taking her, I caught on to every concept. Going to her office hours helped a ton as well. She is one of the nicest and caring professors ever! Take her!!

Professor Watson was easily the best professor I have had. She was very understanding when it came to my ongoing medical condition and she did everything she could to help me succeed. I took her class in the fall of 2021, I ended up failing because of my health condition l, but then I took her again in the spring of 2023 and she recognized me

Professor Watson is an amazing professor. The course may be difficult to people who are not math savvy but that is due to the content rather than professor Watson herself. She explained EVERY topic clearly and gave methods for solving questions quickly. Her tests are straight from the homework and very doable. She is also incredibly kind and caring
She only gives 13 homeworks (

DO THE HOMEWORK! She takes time to answer questions and gives partial credit on tests. She goes a little fast but walks through everything. Overall, not a bad teacher. Not sure what some of these other reviews are talking about. Do the work, come to class, and you'll be fine.

Well to start, Mrs. Watson is nothing extraordinary. That said, she is an effective choice when picking professors. Her class is efficient, but she will stop and answer questions when you have them. (BUT YOU HAVE TO ASK!!!) She doesn't do extra credit, however she does give partial credit on tests (unsure what the other reviews are talking about)
Goes through slides very quickly and grades veryyyy harshly. I suggest not taking her class unless you are already very good at the math subject.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: no extra credit, says she gives partial credit but never does, doesn't explain why youre wrong but instead just draws a line and "-x points," so many assignments on aleks that are due on random days instead of a set day they're due each week, closes aleks assignments once you complete them so you cant study them until the day before the test
Ms. Watson is very much meat and potatoes but it works. ALEKS homework can be a little intense at times but the practice is very preparatory for the tests. You will be behind if you miss class.
very kind and will help if you ask, but learning only in class is not enough. she moves very quickly through her lessons and assigns homework constantly on aleks.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Weekly Aleks Homework. End of class Quizzits graded on accuracy as participation grade. Explains concepts really well. Wish she had used a study guide through Aleks instead of a pdf through with answers that have no explanation. That made it really hard to get ready for tests and is my biggest gripe with the class.

Overall a good professor. Very hands on, teaches the content clearly, and gives good feedback on tests. She is willing to help as long as you reach out for help. Otherwise, she wont know who you are. The content isnt super easy. You will have to work for your grade.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: just don't go to her
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Literally just avoid.

Professor Watson was a great professor! She is GREAT at teaching and answering questions and there is not too much homework. There are 3 tests and they are worth 20% each and the final is 15%. Participation is graded on accuracy which seems unfair, but it's not worth that much. Probably the most straightforward a math class you could get.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: She isn't a bad teacher overall. She is nice and is willing to go over things if you don't understand something. She is pretty quick to respond to emails. Beware that participation work is graded on accuracy.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Participation matters
